info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 03 at 4:24PM CST until January 03 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN DE WITT AND NORTH CENTRAL MACON COUNTIES... At 423 PM CST, a confirmed tornado was located over mainly rural areas of Northern Macon County, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Maroa and Rowell. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
